ground_truth: The materials worth Rs.108.18 crore have already been supplied and material worth another Rs. 45.98 crore approx. is expected to be supplied by March end. Major supplies are expected to be completed by July end, with only electrical/instrumentation items, structure sheeting, and some smaller materials left over after March, except for steel structure and some smaller items needed for the second units.

question: What actions might NTPC Limited take if M/s Indure Pvt. Ltd. fails to remedy the slow progress in the coal yard drainage work within 14 days?
ground_truth: If M/s Indure Pvt. Ltd. fails to remedy the slow progress in the coal yard drainage work within 14 days, NTPC will be forced to encash the Bank Guarantees submitted by M/s Indure Private Limited to get the balance work done at the risk and cost of M/s Indure Private Limited. Further, NTPC may take action for termination of contract as per GCC Sub-Clause 42.2.2.

question: What are the objectives of the orientation session proposed by the SANDVIK engineer, in collaboration with INDURE, for the NTPC O&M personnel, particularly in terms of training and operational efficiency?
ground_truth: The objectives of the orientation session proposed by the SANDVIK engineer, in collaboration with INDURE, for the NTPC O&M personnel are to make them conversant with the likely problems/cases of breakdown and the remedial action to be taken for immediate restoration of normal operation. Additionally, the session aims to elaborate on aspects of preventive maintenance.

Date: 22-11-17 06:07 PM Subject: RE: Solapur CHP - Request for deputing SANDVIK engineer Dear Sir,

We certainly do not want any stoppage in operations. The machine SCR 2 10 B is being operated since nearly 11 months now and nearly 2.5 Lac tonnes of coal has been handled. Our team has always provided you back up support when contacted for trouble shooting jobs all through. We are committed towards successful and timely closure of the project and provided the fronts for the S/R 10 Ais made available, load trials can be started without delay.

However, we request you to understand our situation. There is serious questioning from our global management. It is extremely difficult to convince them, how one machine SCR 2 has been taken over and put into commercial operation by the customer for nearly one year without clearing outstanding payment of INR 2.40 Crores to Sandvik . Situation is worsened by the fact that SCR 110A is ready and waiting for nearly 2 years for readiness of conveyor stream. Regular reminders and requests to you for resolution are not being responded.

Your plan towards resolution of the above points will be helpful for us to appraise our finance / global

management for sustenance of support services as requested below. Thanking you in anticipation of your support.

With Regards,

question: What issues are being faced regarding the painting of fabricated structures for the Solapur Super Thermal Power Project?
ground_truth: The issues being faced regarding the painting of fabricated structures for the Solapur Super Thermal Power Project include problems due to inclement weather conditions in and around Delhi, which have prevented the issuance of MDCC for the painted structures, resulting in the accumulation of stock at factory/fabrication yards and affecting further manufacturing.

Additionally, the order for the Hydraulic Power pack had to be changed recently even after approval of the main drawings of the wagon tippler.

question: What experience does The Indure Private Limited have with supplying gates to NTPC power stations?
ground_truth: The Indure Private Limited has experience supplying more than thirty (30) units of gates to various NTPC power stations, including Dadri STPP Stage- Wl, Vindhyachal STPP, Ramagundam STPP Stage-I/Stage-II, Talcher STPP, Farakka STPP, and Kahalgaon STPP. These gates have been working satisfactorily for the last thirty (30) years.
contexts:
the issue with the senior authorities in Quality Assurance Department for clearing the manufacturing of Flap Gates, Rack & Pinion Gates at our Works. We, once again requested to Quality Assurance Department for review of the decision in view of that —

(i) We are manufacturing more than similar Isolation Gates installed in the Gate Housing of Bottom Ash Hopper, Bottom Ash Discharge Gate in the Scraper Conveyor and Hydrobin Gates and have supplied these Gates to various reputed customers all over India including more than thirty (30) units of NTPC. These gates are working/have worked satisfactorily for last thirty (30) years at various power stations including Dadri STPP Stage- Wl, Vindhyachal STPP, Ramagundam STPP Stage-I/Stage-!I, Talcher STPP, Farakka STPP, Kahalgaon STPP of NTPC.

(ii) As submitted in our letter, size of the gates supplied by us for isolation, have got similar or larger openings and having almost same duty with more design loads than required in flap gates.

Moreover, the quantity being supplied to NTPC — Soiapur is small and we can manufacture the same in three (3) months time and therefore the time shall be no constrain whatsoever in this regard.

(iii) As regards, the structural fabrication is concerned, you are kindly aware that we have already fabricated/supplied approx. 2500 MT of structural material for Solapur besides

question: What problems delayed Solapur STPP's work by mid-Sept 2015?
ground_truth: The problems that delayed Solapur STPP's work by mid-Sept 2015 included continuous slippage in commitments by Indure, lack of improvement in the progress of shop fabrication, non-commencement of supplies from Essar works, frequent stoppage of site works due to payment issues, and shortage of steel, cement, electrodes, and paints.

question: How did GST in 2017 impact NTPC's Solapur Project contracts and reimbursements?
ground_truth: The GST implementation by the Government of India on 1.7.17 impacted NTPC's Solapur Project contracts as the exemption in taxes and duties, which was applicable against the Solapur Project being a Mega Power Project, was withdrawn. For imported materials, the exemption was only available against custom duty, but IGST at 18% of CIF value was levied. The full GST payment was made against all indigenous supplies, with GST rates ranging from 18% to 28%. NTPC decided on 6th Nov. 2017 for partial reimbursement of GST at the rate of 14.5% against the levy of 28/18%, but 5% was deducted towards input tax credit, resulting in only 9.5% being reimbursed. The decision for reimbursement took 1 to 2 months to implement and was initially applicable for 3 months, later extended to Jan. 2019, and further agreed to be made after 21 months on 15-4-2020, but full GST payment was not yet received.

In view of the above we would request you to kindly accept our request for deemed conductance of PG test as clearly and categorically provided in the contract and release the payment against the same and also arrange the payment of balance GST.

3: You are kindly aware that in spite of above delays by the Employer and our incurring huge additional expenditure not included in the contract due to above delays and also same not reimbursed to us as per provision of the contract, we continue to attend these pending works which were proceeding at slow pace due to shortage funds because of non -reimbursement of extra expenditure incurred. The same came to standstill due to Corona pandemics earlier due to lock down and now partly due to NTPC reluctance to allow entry of our workers and staff members and partly due to non-availability workers & staff in Maharashtra because of its Worst in the country having maximum cases.

We are giving below the work wise position chronically and assure you to complete the same as soon as Corona effects will minimize but we would request you to kindly arrange reimbursement of extra expenditure incurred as soon as possible besides release of other balance payments namely remaining GST payment as explained above, refund of interest deducted and other unjustified deductions etc .

GUARANTEES / WARANTEES

NTPC invited the bids for “complete scope of works of design, engineering, manufacture, fabrication, dispatch, transportation, delivery at site, erection, testing, commissioning of the complete coal handling system as specified, with associated civil structural works with the warrantees/ guarantees for a period of 12 months from the date of operation acceptance of the “facilities” or 18 months from the date of successful completion of facilities and the facilities as define in GCC means equipments and material to be supplied and installed as well as all the installation services to be carried out by the contractor.”

As such the completion of supplies and services were to be matching with the expected commissioning of Unit so as to avoid the expiry of the Warrantees/Guarantees of equipments /material / service. The warrantees/ guarantees which usually commences from the date of their supply, whereas the contract stipulates the commencement of the Warrantees/Guarantees from the date of operational acceptance / completion of facilities which is dependent upon coal firing /commissioning of the unit & its running for required period on full load.

Fixation of minimum floor price of steel materials and imposition of anti- dumping duty

The Government of India vide notification No.38/2015-2020 dated 5'" February, 2016 notified the minimum floor price of steel materials which was much above the domestic steel price and anti-dumping duty was also imposed over and above the same. The same resulted to steep price in increase of domestic steel. Such a steep price increase was not considered while finalizing the contract as the same had not taken place in last over 10 years.

The price adjustment as per the formula given in the contract gave the price increase upto 10 % whereas there has been on average price increase @ 70 to 100% since award of the contract.

As submitted time and again and also during the NTPC vendor meet on 10° Dec. 2018 convened in presence/ leadership of Hon’ble Chairman and other NTPC officials, we had submitted that the NTPC price adjustment formula does not give the actual market price increase, as the PVC formula is based on the RBI indices which hardly moves, resulting to, therefore negligible price increase.

The price adjustment provision given in the contract envisages the price adjustment which reflects the changes in cost of labour and materials component. The first para of Appendix-2, page “1 of

9” of the contract regarding Price Adjustment reads as under:

GST Payment:

As stated above the supplies were to be matched with release of fronts/ unit commissioning schedule to avoid expiry of warrantees & guarantees & also damages/ deterioration in materials. Therefore wherever and to the extent possible the supplies were to be delayed.

In the meanwhile, the GST was implemented by Govt. of India w.e.f 1.7.17 and the exemption in taxes and duties which was applicable against Solapur Project being Mega Power Project, was withdrawn. In case of imported material, the exemption was made available only against custom duty but IGST @ 18% of CIF value against all the imported materials was levied. The full GST payment was being made against all indigenous supplies. The GST was made applicable @ 18% to 28% which now has been brought down to 18% against most of items.

Ms. NTPC took a decision on 6" Nov. 2017 for partial reimbursement of GST at the rate of 14.5% against levy of 28/ 18%. Even from the partial reimbursement

of 14.5%, the 5% was deducted towards input tax credit which was not applicable as all the input tax credits were available during the earlier tax regime also. Thus in actuals only 9.5% was reimbursed against 28/ 8% GST. The implementation of the decision took another 1 to 2 months on finalization of invoice format and other formalities. As such the decision for reimbursement of partial GST payment could be implemented almost after 8 months and that too the same was initially applicable only for another 3 months’ time, i.e. upto March, 2018 and thereafter on June 2018 has extended Upto Jan. 2019 for two month prior to propose COD of the units. Thereafter again on our repeated submissions GST payment was agreed to be made after to 21 months i.e. on 15-4-2020.The actual payment not yet received but full GST has not been admitted/ made even till date

We have been repeatedly submitting to NTPC that the GST was complete overhauling of indirect tax structure of the country. The complete Constitution with all relevant Articles of our constitution in respect of Indirect Taxes have been Deleted and instead of new provisions have been incorporated levying GST Therefore it may not be treated as ordinary amendment to tax provisions and the existing provisions of the contract would be no more valid . Our contract was governed by old constitutional provisions of indirect taxes and since the same no more exist, either the contract become Void to that extent or the provisions with regard to indirect taxes be amended to provide for GST payment to keep the contract remain valid &so as to make the same at par for both the parties.

It would also be Unjust Enrichment also for NTPC as GST was

incorporated/being incorporated as a capital cost for tariff purpose. But in spite of

same its payment was inordinately delayed and full payment was not made to us.

Thus NTPC enriched itself by 3.5 % to 13.5 % besides interest charged from us Engineered Durable Products

question: What stops coating damage in metal sheet transport?
ground_truth: The protective guard film of polyethylene (about 40 micron thickness) over the profiled metal sheets stops coating damage during transportation and handling.

question: What factors delayed NTPC Solapur payments, like villagers' protests, royalty demands, and vendor approvals?
ground_truth: The factors that delayed NTPC Solapur payments include villagers' protests, royalty demands, and vendor approvals. Villagers stopped work at the project site multiple times, leading to work stoppages. Royalty demands were raised by the district administration despite payments being made, resulting in payment holds. Delays in vendor approvals, such as for structural fabrication and manufacturing of specific components, also contributed to the delays.

iv. Scarcity of sand, metal around Solapur

When we commenced the civil works were informed that there used to be a local Govt. restrictions on mining of sand and metal for construction purpose in and around Solapur. The Notifications are issued by district authorities every year. As a matter of fact, the District Authorities / Mining Deptt. were auctioning the mining of sand

& and metal for limit period excavation. The auctioning taken place around Sept. to Oct/Nov. every year. The Mining Deptt. finalized tenders from Oct. to Dec. every year and. the Mining rights are awarded to successful parties for mining for a definite period which is approx. for six months from Feb. to Sept. every year.

The following notifications restriction the mining activities for six months during 2014, 2015 and 2016 may kindly be referred in this regard.

NOTIFICATION NO.& DATE Office/2/Guokh/RR/1935/14/Solapur 22.12.2014

Office/2/Guokh/RR/4014/Solapur did. 14:16.2075 Office/2/Guokh/RR/2931/Solapur 25.10.2016

The above notifications are for 2014, 2015 and 2016. But similar process was for earlier years also whereby mining had been restricted for almost six months every year.

The copies of the same are attached herewith for your perusal and ready reference. The restrictions of mining of sand/ metal were neither specified in tender documents nor informed to us during finalization of the contract.

In the process during that period the sand and metal had to be procured from far-away from Solapur. The same resulted to increase in price substantially besides slow delivery of materials. It effected execution of civil works for no fault of ours.

Vv. Stoppage of work by villagers

The work was stopped by villagers 2-3 times at project site. The villagers surrounded complete project area right from boundary wall and were not allowing the entry of workers, staff, vehicles from 20.06.13 to 24.06.13, from 7.1.16 to 9.1.16 & 19.9.16 to 27.9.16. As a matter of fact, the villagers had forced the workers staying at adjoining places, to left Solapur and not joined the work at site. During the villagers agitation less than 10% of the workforce somehow could be taken to site. After the agitation was over the workforce which left Solapur earlier had again come to site, In the process work was stopped almost for 1% months for no fault of ours. The same was already informed to NTPC by our various communications from time to time and neither NTPC nor district authorities. could take any corrective checks either to remove the workers / villagers surrounding the project site nor could reach any settlement with them. It also effected the execution at site badly during peak time in 2016.

vi. Royalty

M/s. NTPC also issue a letter no. Sholapur/CCD dtd. 9.3.2016 to us for settling the issue within a week's time and otherwise stopping the payment. Our payments were stopped / slowed down for almost two (2) months thereafter.

question: What delayed the re-submission of engineering docs for the Wagon Tippler Complex?
ground_truth: The re-submission of engineering documents for the Wagon Tippler Complex was delayed because the finalized layout of the rail track in the Wagon Tippler Complex was not made available, which delayed the ordering for the Side Arm Charger and other equipment, resulting in a delay in submission of equipment GA Drawing and the GA Drawing of Wagon Tippler Complex.

question: How did late Wagon Tippler details and design changes affect the coal project's timeline?
ground_truth: The late furnishing of the Rail track layout, location, and coordinates of the Wagon Tippler area delayed the designing, ordering, supply, and execution at the site by almost six months. Additionally, changes in the Bunker level and Tripper finished floor level resulted in a delay in designing the civil/structural work and other connected galleries by almost 3.5 months.
contexts:
NTPC stated above. We are briefly enumerating the same as under:

(I Delay in Wagon Tippler Complex - Inputs

We had furnished WT complex GA as per Tender Drawings. We have made several requests since beginning for furnishing the final Rail Track layout of Wagon Tippler complex area and location / coordinates of Wagon Tippler so that we can make the corresponding GA drawings and thereafter civil excavation and civil designs and drawings and commence the civil works including excavation. We made several requests to NTPC including our letter no.1-5026/SSTPP/CHP/11 dtd.15.6.12 and our letter no.I-5026/SSTPP/CHP/16 dtd. 20.08.12. In absence of the coordinates of the Wagon Tippler and track layout, we could not be able to take up the civil design / works particularly excavation and further design/ civil engineering works. The same inordinately delayed the execution / civil works of the main segment of the Coal Handling system ie. Wagon Tippler complex area and ordering, further design/ engineering manufacturing / supply.

Therefore the designing, ordering, supply, execution at site was delayed almost by six months. In the revised track layout the inhaul and outhaul side were interchanged along with the shifting of Wagon Tippler complex. The profile of conveyor 2A | 2B for which we had already submitted the drawing earlier and NTPC gave the comments, was also changed. We had to re-design the GA of WT complex and conveyor 2A/ 2B after a delay of more than six months along with the other connected equipments and civil / structural designs and drawings. This also delayed the ordering for Side Arm Charger and other connected equipments of Wagon Tippler complex resulting to inordinate delay in submission of designs and drawings, civil works, supply of materials.

2. Change in Bunker Level and Tripper Finish Floor Level

We had given conveyor profile drawings with the design of our conveyors and other connected TP’s as per the tender drawings. However,BGR / NTPC formally informed us the change in Bunker level, during discussions on 48 July 2012 as recorded in MOM dtd. 18.07.12 & 7 Sept. 2012. We were also intimated the Tripper finished floor level of 54.4 mtr instead of 59.4 mtr. as indicated in tender drawings. Accordingly, the top floor level of the Conveyor Drives / TP’s right from TP2 had to be lowered down. During a further discussions on 7.9.12 we could furnish our requirement of top floor level of TP-6/ TP-7/ TP-8/ TP-9 based on the Tripper floor level of 54.4 mtr. The change in Tripper floor levels that too after almost 3 % months of award of the contract, had resulted to delay in designing of the civil / structural work and other connected galleries all the TP’s conveyors etc. by almost 3 % months.

question: How did NTPC's input delays and 'DR' equipment categorization impact the Solapur project's engineering submission timeline?
ground_truth: NTPC's input delays and 'DR' equipment categorization significantly impacted the Solapur project's engineering submission timeline. The clearance for the Rail Track with coordinates for the Wagon Tippler Complex was delayed by six months, and the clearance for 'DR' category equipment, such as the Apron Feeder, was only received in December 2012. These delays, along with protracted deliberations on floor levels and delayed concurrence on gearbox selection, resulted in a 5-6 month delay in the finalization of mechanical system drawings and the subsequent submission of related electrical and civil & structural drawings.

question: Were there any issues with the pile cap design at the NTPC site due to misaligned piles?
ground_truth: Yes, there were issues with the pile cap design at the NTPC site due to misaligned piles. The location of piles was not as per the approved pile layout in the stacker reclaimer area, leading to the need to either discard these piles or change the pile cap drawing to accommodate the existing piles.

on these piles. Accordingly, the pile cap designs / drawings submitted by us on 8.6.2016 and the same were approved on 15.9.16. However, when we / our sub-contractor excavated the area, for breaking the pile for pile cap we observed that location of piles are not as per the approved pile layout in stacker reclaimer area. Therefore we have to either discard these piles or if possible change the pile cap drawing and accommodate the existing piles so as to do the further civil work as per requirement of the stacker reclaimer.

We are now looking for both the possibilities and incase it would be

@ possible to use the existing piles we shall redesign the pile cap and subsequent civil works. Incase it would not be possible to use the existing piles we have to do the piles once again and in that event NTPC has to pay the extra expenditure in lieu of existing piles. In any case it delayed the further civil works by atleast four (4) months.

question: What measures are taken to ensure the Colour-Coated Sheets remain undamaged during handling and transportation?
ground_truth: The measures taken to ensure the Colour-Coated Sheets remain undamaged during handling and transportation include providing a protective guard film to avoid damage to the coating during handling, packing and transporting the sheets with due care, and performing necessary touch-up painting on receipt at the site before fixing/erection if any damage occurs.
contexts:
You will agree that the protective guard film is provided only to avoid any damage to the coating during handling, and the strength and other features of the Colour-Coated Sheets will remain intact, even in the absence of the guard film. Further, we will ensure that the Sheets are packed and transported with due care, so that there is no damage during handling. If at all, any damage to the coating takes place during handling, necessary touch-up painting shall be done, on receipt at site, but before the fixing/ erection of the Sheets..

We request that necessary clarification may kindly be given, so that MDCC for the Colour- Coated Sheets is issued to us.

Thanking you,

Yours faithfully For THE INDURE PRIVATE LIMITED
